title: Fedor (Theodore) Gerasimov
text:
I am a rising 3-rd year Mathematics PhD student at Rice University.
My interests are discrete and convex geometry, topology, and combinatorics.
In 2023, I received my B.S. in Applied Mathematics and Computer Science from the Moscow Institute of Physics and Technology.

title: Fedor Gerasimov
text:
I am passionate about teaching Mathematics and, more broadly, helping others discover the beauty and accessibility of math through visual and geometric thinking.


Teaching Experience

Tapia Camp
Mathematics Instructor — Summer 2025 Tapia Camps are award-winning residential STEM camps for high school students organized by the Tapia Center at Rice University. I taught the “Techniques of a Pro Mathematician” curriculum, a week-long course on the fundamental principles that professionals use to learn and do math more efficiently and effectively.
CMOR 360: Introduction to Optimization and Operations Research
Teaching Assistant — Spring 2025 Held office hours, graded assignments, and provided academic support to students throughout the semester.
Lyceum “The Second School”
Competitive Math Coach — September 2021 to May 2022 Led two 2-hour weekly classes preparing high school students for Russian national math competitions.
